description:
Assessed income tax

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
73111 Wage and income tax statistics

Definition:
The assessable income tax comprises the income tax according
to the tax scale, reduced by credits for foreign taxes paid
and any tax relief, and increased by tax as per Section 34c
(5), additional tax as specified in Section 10 (5), the
surcharge as per Section 3 (4), second sentence, of the
Forest Damage Compensation Act, and the entitlement to a
supplementary pension allowance as specified in Section 10a
(2). If, in the circumstances specified in Section 31, the
income is reduced by a tax-free allowance as per Section 32
(6), the assessable income tax is computed by adding
children's allowance to the income tax according to the tax
scale.
